comments.text: Yes, is a good example, but is not what I'm looking for. In your example, if I change the stroke to 33 I get the same result if I put the stroke to 200 or 2000, and that's the problem, I need a big and real width. Another problem is the zoom, I need the real width when I use the zoom, but my first problem is get a big width. Maybe using another object?

@LuisSM - the max stroke weight appears to be 32 for a polyline. The polyline width will always be THAT weight, it doesn't matter wether you zoom, it will be the exact same size on your screen. So weight 10 with a map zoom of 8 will look the same as weight 10 with a map zoom of 3. Is this what you mean with "real width"? What exactly is it you are trying to achieve?

Yes, that's what I mean and that's my problem. I need something like circles to draw a route (like a polyline, with multipoint) but with radius or width customized. And example, a route with some Km or Miles as width.
